intro: Xysmalobium leucotrichum, commonly known as the white-tailed larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, spurred flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces delicate, blue to purple flowers. It has finely divided, fern-like leaves and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. However, it is toxic to livestock and should be handled with care.
